name: Luke's Landspeeder

banner.text: I'd forgotten how much I hate space travel. It's good to be back on solid ground.

steps.openFlyoutCopy: Use the Object: lerp blocks in the code space to move Luke and the landspeeder. Open the ${toolbox#forceKit} tray.
steps.grabBlockCopy: Drag the Force Kit: pointer x block into the code space.

steps.openFlyoutCopy: Set the Y position of the landspeeder so it moves up and down with your hand. Open the ${toolbox#math} tray.
steps.grabBlockCopy: Drag this block into the code space.

steps.bannerCopy: Change <kc-string-preview>0</kc-string-preview> to <kc-string-preview>600</kc-string-preview>.
Change <kc-string-preview>+</kc-string-preview> to <kc-string-preview>-</kc-string-preview> from the dropdown list.

steps.grabBlockCopy: Drag the Force kit: height block into the code space.

steps.text: Move your hand left and right to pilot the landspeeder. Uh oh... you've forgotten Luke!

steps.openFlyoutCopy: Set the position of Luke to sit him in the landspeeder. Open the ${toolbox#math} tray.
steps.grabBlockCopy: Drag this block into the code space.
Drag this block into the code space.

steps.bannerCopy: Change <kc-string-preview>+</kc-string-preview> to <kc-string-preview>- subtract</kc-string-preview> from the dropdown list.
Move Luke back by subtracting <kc-string-preview>20</kc-string-preview>.

steps.openFlyoutCopy: Now you're going to set Luke's y position too. Open the ${toolbox#math} tray.
steps.grabBlockCopy: Drag this block into the code space.

steps.bannerCopy: Change <kc-string-preview>0</kc-string-preview> to <kc-string-preview>560</kc-string-preview>.
Change <kc-string-preview>+</kc-string-preview> to <kc-string-preview>- subtract</kc-string-preview> from the dropdown list.

steps.grabBlockCopy: Drag this block into the code space.

steps.text: That's better, now Luke and his landspeeder can hurtle across the Tatooine desert together.

steps.openFlyoutCopy: Add a particle effect to make it look like the landspeeder is kicking up sand. Open the ${toolbox#particle} tray.
steps.grabBlockCopy: Drag the Particle: create block into the code space.

steps.openFlyoutCopy: First you're going to set the x position of the particles so they follow the landspeeder. Open the ${toolbox#math} tray.
steps.grabBlockCopy: Drag this block into the code space.
steps.connectCopy: Connect to the particle x position.

steps.grabBlockCopy: Drag the Object: get position block into the code space.

steps.bannerCopy: Change <kc-string-preview>random</kc-string-preview> to <kc-string-preview>X-34 landspeeder</kc-string-preview>.
Change <kc-string-preview>+</kc-string-preview> to <kc-string-preview>- subtract</kc-string-preview> from the dropdown list.

steps.openFlyoutCopy: Randomize the x position by adding a random number block. Open the ${toolbox#math} tray.
steps.grabBlockCopy: Drag the random number block into the code space.

steps.bannerCopy: Change <kc-string-preview>10</kc-string-preview> to <kc-string-preview>150</kc-string-preview>.

steps.openFlyoutCopy: Now set the Y position of the particles so they're underneath the landspeeder. Open the ${toolbox#math} tray.
steps.grabBlockCopy: Drag this block into the code space.
steps.connectCopy: Connect to the particle y position.

steps.openFlyoutCopy: Open the ${toolbox#position} tray to get another Object: position block.
steps.grabBlockCopy: Drag this block into the code space.

steps.bannerCopy: Change <kc-string-preview>x position</kc-string-preview> to <kc-string-preview>y position</kc-string-preview>.
Change <kc-string-preview>random</kc-string-preview> to <kc-string-preview>X-34 landspeeder</kc-string-preview>
Bring the particles further down by adding <kc-string-preview>20</kc-string-preview>.

steps.openFlyoutCopy: Direct the particles so they fly behind the landspeeder. Open the ${toolbox#particle} tray.
steps.grabBlockCopy: Drag the Particle: force direction block into the code space.
Drag this block into the code space.

steps.bannerCopy: Change <kc-string-preview>0</kc-string-preview> to <kc-string-preview>260</kc-string-preview>.
Change <kc-string-preview>10</kc-string-preview> to <kc-string-preview>290</kc-string-preview>.
Change the strength of the particles from <kc-string-preview>10</kc-string-preview> to <kc-string-preview>8</kc-string-preview> to slow them down.

steps.openFlyoutCopy: Next you'll change the colour of the particles so they look more like dust and sand. Open the ${toolbox#particle} tray.
steps.grabBlockCopy: Drag this block into the code space.

steps.bannerCopy: Change <kc-color-preview color="#000000"></kc-color-preview> to a sandy color, like <kc-color-preview color="#FFFDE7"></kc-color-preview>.
Change <kc-color-preview color="#000000"></kc-color-preview> to to another sandy color <kc-color-preview color="#FFF8E1"></kc-color-preview>.

steps.openFlyoutCopy: Now change the size of the particles. Open the ${toolbox#particle} tray.
steps.grabBlockCopy: Drag the Particle: size block into the code space.

steps.bannerCopy: Change the start size of the particles to <kc-string-preview>2</kc-string-preview>.
Change the end size of the particles to <kc-string-preview>40</kc-string-preview> so they get bigger over time.

steps.openFlyoutCopy: Make the particles more see-through using a transparency block. Open the ${toolbox#particle} tray.
steps.grabBlockCopy: Drag the Particle: transparency block into the code space.

steps.bannerCopy: Change the end transparency from <kc-string-preview>100</kc-string-preview> to <kc-string-preview>20</kc-string-preview> so they disappear over time.

steps.openFlyoutCopy: To finish off you're going to change how long the particles are on the canvas for. Open the ${toolbox#particle} tray.
steps.grabBlockCopy: Drag the Particle: lifespan block into the code space.

steps.bannerCopy: Change <kc-string-preview>1000</kc-string-preview> to <kc-string-preview>300</kc-string-preview> so each particle only appears for 300 frames.

steps.text: Move your hand to pilot the X-34. Oh my, this planet is dusty.

banner.text: The binary sunset on Tatooine does make my processors tingle. But I can't stand the sand.
